results.title: Blood Pressure Control and Incident Left-Ventricular Conduction Disease.
results.text_hl: In randomized trials, intensive blood pressure control among @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ individuals reduced the incidence of @DISEASE_Ventricular_Dysfunction_Left @DISEASE_MESH:D018487 @@@left-ventricular conduction abnormalities@@@ in the form of @<m>DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@fascicular- and left bundle branch blocks@@@, while treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ independent of blood pressure control appeared to reduce @DISEASE_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D004194 @@@conduction disease@@@ risk.

citations.NLM: Frimodt-Møller EK, Marcus GM. Blood Pressure Control and Incident Left-Ventricular Conduction Disease. Curr Cardiol Rep. 2025 Jan 20;27(1):29. PMID: 39831954
citations.BibTeX: @article{39831954, title={Blood Pressure Control and Incident Left-Ventricular Conduction Disease.}, author={Frimodt-Møller EK and Marcus GM}, journal={Curr Cardiol Rep}, volume={27}, number={1}, pages={29}}

results.title: Chest pain associated with rate-related left bundle branch block and cardiac memory mimicking ischemia.
results.text_hl: Her @DISEASE_Chest_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pains@@@ may have been caused by the intermittent, rate-related @<m>DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@LBBB@@@, as control of her heart rate and blood pressure with @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ improved her symptoms on follow-up.

citations.NLM: Malozzi C, Wenzel G, Karumbaiah K, Courtney M, Omar B. Chest pain associated with rate-related left bundle branch block and cardiac memory mimicking ischemia. J Cardiol Cases. 2014 Mar;9(3):87-90. PMID: 30534304
citations.BibTeX: @article{30534304, title={Chest pain associated with rate-related left bundle branch block and cardiac memory mimicking ischemia.}, author={Malozzi C and Wenzel G and Karumbaiah K and Courtney M and Omar B}, journal={J Cardiol Cases}, volume={9}, number={3}, pages={87-90}}

results.title: ECG of the month. Irregular rhythm in a 25-year-old man with three prior cardiac operations. Coarse atrial fibrillation with a rapid ventricular response, left anterior fascicular block, left ventricular hypertrophy with repolarization abnormality.
results.text_hl: Coarse @DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@ with a rapid ventricular response, @<m>DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@left anterior fascicular block@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@left ventricular hypertrophy@@@ with repolarization abnormality.

citations.NLM: Glancy DL, Ahmed J, Ayalloore SG, LeLorier PA, Diwan PM, Helmcke FR. ECG of the month. Irregular rhythm in a 25-year-old man with three prior cardiac operations. Coarse atrial fibrillation with a rapid ventricular response, left anterior fascicular block, left ventricular hypertrophy with repolarization abnormality. J La State Med Soc. 2013 Jan-Feb;165(1):40-1. PMID: 23550397
citations.BibTeX: @article{23550397, title={ECG of the month. Irregular rhythm in a 25-year-old man with three prior cardiac operations. Coarse atrial fibrillation with a rapid ventricular response, left anterior fascicular block, left ventricular hypertrophy with repolarization abnormality.}, author={Glancy DL and Ahmed J and Ayalloore SG and LeLorier PA and Diwan PM and Helmcke FR}, journal={J La State Med Soc}, volume={165}, number={1}, pages={40-1}}

results.title: Effect of antihypertensive therapy on development of incident conduction system disease in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: Previous work has demonstrated that treatment of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with the @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@angiotensin-converting enzyme@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ was associated with a reduced incidence of a composite @DISEASE_Cardiac_Conduction_System_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000075224 @@@conduction system disease@@@ endpoint and also @<m>DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@left bundle branch block@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Bundle_Branch_Block</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002037 @@@LBBB@@@) compared with @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Okin PM, Kjeldsen SE, Devereux RB. Effect of antihypertensive therapy on development of incident conduction system disease in hypertensive patients. J Hypertens. 2019 Mar;37(3):629-635. PMID: 30676480
citations.BibTeX: @article{30676480, title={Effect of antihypertensive therapy on development of incident conduction system disease in hypertensive patients.}, author={Okin PM and Kjeldsen SE and Devereux RB}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={37}, number={3}, pages={629-635}}
